title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate in Singapore 2024
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 3 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2024 to 2019.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2017 to 2014.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2017.
gold: Singapore posted a gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate of 3.7 percent in 2017 , after adjusting for inflation . While up from the previous two years , this number is expected to decline in 2018 , settling around 3.14 percent . What is GDP ? GDP is a measure of a country 's income , and most economists agree that slow but steady GDP growth is best for a developed economy .
